item.title: Animal rights activists have slammed Gucci for using real tigers in an ad campaign shoot.
item.dc:creator: Admin
item.description: Gucci, an Italian luxury fashion house, has come under fire on social media for using real tigers in their advertising campaign. The Gucci Tiger Collection debuted earlier this month to commemorate the Chinese Year of the Tiger, which begins on February 1st. Many animal rights activists, including the founder of Big Cat Rescue, Carole Baskin, […]
item.content:encoded:
Gucci, an Italian luxury fashion house, has come under fire on social media for using real tigers in their advertising campaign. The Gucci Tiger Collection debuted earlier this month to commemorate the Chinese Year of the Tiger, which begins on February 1st. Many animal rights activists, including the founder of Big Cat Rescue, Carole Baskin, and PETA, were outraged by their decision to use real tigers for the shoot.

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by Gucci Official (@gucci)

One of the images from Gucci’s recent campaign features two tigers, one perched on a piano and the other posing on a rug. In another Instagram video shared by Gucci, a tiger is seen walking.

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by Gucci Official (@gucci)

Carole Baskin, an animal activist, called it the “worst possible message.” “This type of ad campaign sends the worst possible message: that tigers are disposable commodities to be used for capitalism and discarded at will,” she told Yahoo News. She went on to say that it diminishes the tiger’s majesty and makes Gucci look bad.

World Animal Protection US also expressed their dismay on Twitter. “Gucci is sending the wrong message by promoting tigers as pets and luxury items when they are wild animals that belong in the wild,” according to the tweet.

The People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals (PETA) also slammed Gucci on Twitter earlier this month.

When will Gucci learn that animals are not props!

Tweet at @gucci and tell them to STOP using wild animals in their ads. pic.twitter.com/QnH7xjtZzS

— PETA (@peta) January 6, 2022

Several netizens also expressed their opinions in the comments section of Gucci’s posts. “Please leave the wildlife alone,” one user wrote. “Tigers are beautiful in nature, not in marketing campaigns,” another commenter writes.

Gucci, on the other hand, stated in their disclaimer that no animals were harmed during the shoot. “Tigers were photographed and filmed in a separate safe environment in accordance with Gucci’s policies before being featured in the campaign,” the disclaimer continued. Netizens, on the other hand, are clearly not convinced.

item.title: In India, Kodak introduces Magsafe wireless iPhone chargers for the car and home.
item.dc:creator: Admin
item.description: Kodak, a well-known photography company based in the United States, is collaborating with an Indian company, Georgian Enterprises, to launch wireless chargers for the Apple iPhone 12 and iPhone 13 series in India. The price of the two wireless chargers, the Kodak car WCM101C, is Rs 2,499. “We are excited to announce this licensing agreement […]
item.content:encoded:
Kodak, a well-known photography company based in the United States, is collaborating with an Indian company, Georgian Enterprises, to launch wireless chargers for the Apple iPhone 12 and iPhone 13 series in India. The price of the two wireless chargers, the Kodak car WCM101C, is Rs 2,499.

“We are excited to announce this licensing agreement with Georgian Enterprises to further expand Kodak’s consumer electronics presence in the Indian market,” said Clara Fort, Vice President of Global Brand Licensing for Kodak.

Kodak, a well-known photography company based in the United States, is collaborating with an Indian company, Georgian Enterprises, to launch wireless chargers for the Apple iPhone 12 and iPhone 13 series in India. The price of the two wireless chargers, the Kodak car WCM101C, is Rs 2,499.

“We are excited to announce this licensing agreement with Georgian Enterprises to further expand Kodak’s consumer electronics presence in the Indian market,” said Clara Fort, Vice President of Global Brand Licensing for Kodak.

The charger’s body also features a 360-degree rotating ball mount that allows you to position your iPhone horizontally or vertically. When using your phone for navigation, this helps to create a suitable and optimal viewing angle with the best display position.

The Kodak Magnetic Wireless Charger WCM201 for home or office also includes a high-speed 15W desk chargercum-stand. It has the same neodymium magnets for a secure hold as the car charger, but it has a compact kickstand that allows users to position the phone upright.

Both the Kodak Magnetic Wireless Charger for Car and the Kodak Magnetic Wireless Charger for Home is compatible with Apple’s iPhone 13, iPhone 13 Pro, and iPhone 13 Pro Max. iPhone 13 Mini, iPhone 12 Pro, iPhone 12 Pro Max, and iPhone 12 Mini.

All you need is a compatible USB car or wall charger with a power output of up to 20 watts for maximum charging speed. The chargers come with a USB cable and a one-year standard warranty.

item.title: Gaspard Ulliel, the star of Marvel’s ‘Moon Knight’ series, died at the age of 37 in a skiing accident.
item.dc:creator: Admin
item.description: Gaspard Ulliel, one of France’s most celebrated actors and a star of Marvel’s upcoming ‘Moon Knight’ series, died on Wednesday after a skiing accident, according to news agency AFP. He was 37 years old. The two-time Cesar Award winner was hospitalized on Tuesday after suffering a head injury and did not recover, according to the […]
item.content:encoded:
Gaspard Ulliel, one of France’s most celebrated actors and a star of Marvel’s upcoming ‘Moon Knight’ series, died on Wednesday after a skiing accident, according to news agency AFP. He was 37 years old.

The two-time Cesar Award winner was hospitalized on Tuesday after suffering a head injury and did not recover, according to the actor’s family and local agent. He was involved in a collision on the slopes of the Savoie region.

“Gaspard Ulliel grew up with cinema, and cinema grew with him,” French Prime Minister Jean Castex said in a heartfelt tribute to the late actor. They were madly in love with each other. We will miss seeing his most beautiful interpretations with a heavy heart. We have a French actor who has passed away.”

On social media, people are paying their respects to Gaspard Ulliel. Filmmaker Peter Webber, who directed Ulliel in Hannibal Rising, French director and actor Xavier Dolan, who cast the actor as the lead in his It’s Only the End of the World, and French actors Jean Dujardin, Juliette Binoche, and Anthony Delon, among others, all expressed their condolences on the late actor’s death.

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by Xavier Dolan (@xavierdolan)

Ulliel played Midnight Man in ‘Moon Knight,’ but he’s best known for his role in Xavier Dolan’s Canadian-French film ‘It’s Only the End of the World,’ alongside Marion Cotillard, Lea Seydoux, and Vincent Cassel. The film won the Grand Prix at Cannes as well as three Cesars (French Oscars).

In Bertrand Bonello’s biopic ‘Saint Laurent,’ Ulliel also gave a powerful performance as the famous French fashion designer Yves Saint Laurent.

France’s Culture Minister, Roselyne Bachelot, described Ulliel’s death as “so unfair,” saying: “Such a brilliant actor who was reaped by the sickle of death at the peak of his career.”

He was present in our lives for nearly 20 years with magnificent performances, winning his first Cesar for the best male newcomer with ‘A Very Long Engagement.’

The Cannes Film Festival’s Director, Thierry Fremaux, also expressed his condolences. According to ‘Variety,’ Ulliel was a regular on the red carpet in Cannes, where the actor’s films were frequently premiered.

“Gaspard belonged to this new generation of actors who were shaping French cinema for the future.” “He knew how to choose his roles and shape his career in a way that fulfilled every promise,” Fremaux told ‘Variety.’

item.title: Asteroid 7482, the size of the Burj Khalifa, will pass Earth on January 18; will it pose any threat?
item.dc:creator: Admin
item.description: Jagran Trending Desk, New Delhi: Scientists have discovered that an asteroid the size of the Burj Khalifa will fly past Earth at a distance of 1,230,000 miles today, January 18. The asteroid 7482, also known as 1994 PC1, was named by the National Aeronautics and Space Administration and is about 1.6 km wide. It has […]
item.content:encoded:
Jagran Trending Desk, New Delhi: Scientists have discovered that an asteroid the size of the Burj Khalifa will fly past Earth at a distance of 1,230,000 miles today, January 18. The asteroid 7482, also known as 1994 PC1, was named by the National Aeronautics and Space Administration and is about 1.6 km wide. It has been classified as a “potentially hazardous object” due to its proximity to Earth while shooting past.

According to the space agency, an asteroid is “potentially hazardous” if it is 104 meters wide, larger than London’s Big Ben, and has orbits that bring it within 4.6 million miles of Earth’s orbit around the Sun.

Furthermore, it can be a near-Earth object if it is closer than 1.3 au, where 1 au equals 93 million miles.

Will the asteroid 1994 PC1, 7482 cause any harm to the Earth?

Asteroids of this size can cause damage to Earth, but NASA can be confident that 1994 PC1 will safely fly past the planet 1.2 million miles away on January 18.

NASA posted on Twitter, ” “Our #PlanetaryDefense experts have been studying the near-Earth #asteroid 1994 PC1 (1 km wide) for decades. Rest assured that 1994 PC1 will safely fly past our planet 1.2 million miles away on Tuesday, January 18.”

When will the 1994 PC1 come the closest to Earth?

According to NASA Asteroid Watch, the potentially dangerous asteroid will make its closest approach to Earth on January 18 at 4.51 pm EST (3.21 am IST on January 19). It will be the closest approach for this asteroid for at least the next 200 years, according to astronomers’ calculations.

On 15 February 2013, an asteroid called the Chelyabinsk meteor — roughly the size of a six-story building — broke up over Chelyabinsk, Russia.

NASA, the space agency, had previously launched a mission to smash a spacecraft into an asteroid as a test run to prevent a giant space rock from annihilating life on Earth. The Double Asteroid Redirection Test (DART) lifted off from Vandenberg Space Force Base in California at 10:21 p.m. Pacific Time on November 24, 2021, aboard a SpaceX rocket.

Asteroid 2013 YD48 will pass Earth at a distance of 3,480,000 miles on January 11, 2022. Prior to that, at 47,000 miles per hour, an asteroid nearly three times the size of 2013 YD48 passed within 1.9 million miles of Earth.

item.title: Where to travel asia Kind Mid Spirit
item.dc:creator: Admin
item.description: I am alone, and feel the charm of existence in this spot, which was created for the bliss of souls like mine. When, while the lovely valley teems with vapour around me, and the meridian sun strikes the upper surface of the impenetrable foliage of my trees, and but a few stray gleams steal into […]
item.content:encoded:
I am alone, and feel the charm of existence in this spot, which was created for the bliss of souls like mine.

When, while the lovely valley teems with vapour around me, and the meridian sun strikes the upper surface of the impenetrable foliage of my trees, and but a few stray gleams steal into the inner sanctuary, I throw myself down among the tall grass by the trickling stream; and, as I lie close to the earth, a thousand unknown plants are noticed by me: when I hear the buzz of the little world among the

stalks, and grow familiar with the countless indescribable forms of the insects and flies, then I feel the presence of the Almighty, who formed us in his own image, and the breath of that universal love which bears and sustains us, as it floats around us in an eternity of bliss; and then, my friend, when darkness overspreads my eyes, and heaven and earth seem to dwell in my soul and absorb its power, like the form of a beloved mistress, then I often think with longing, Oh, would I could describe these conceptions, could impress upon paper all that is living so full and warm within me, that it might be the mirror of my soul, as my soul is the mirror of the infinite God!

I should be incapable of drawing a single stroke at the present moment; and yet I feel that I never was a greater artist than now.

O my friend — but it is too much for my strength — I sink under the weight of the splendour of these visions! A wonderful serenity has taken possession of my entire soul, like these sweet mornings of spring which I enjoy with my whole heart. I am alone, and feel the charm of existence in this spot, which was created for the bliss of souls like mine.

I am so happy, my dear friend, so absorbed in the exquisite sense of mere tranquil existence, that I neglect my talents. I should be incapable of drawing a single stroke at the present moment; and yet I feel that I never was a greater artist than now. When, while the lovely valley teems with vapour around me, and the meridian sun strikes the upper surface of the impenetrable foliage of my trees, and but a few stray gleams steal into the inner sanctuary, I throw myself down among the tall grass by the trickling stream; and, as I lie close to the earth, a thousand unknown plants are noticed by me: when I hear the buzz of the little world among the stalks, and grow familiar with the countless indescribable forms of the insects and
